front.title: RFC 2544 Applicability Statement: Use on Production Networks Considered Harmful

abstract.t: Benchmarking Methodology Working Group (BMWG) has been developing key performance metrics and laboratory test methods since 1990, and continues this work at present. Recent application of the methods beyond their intended scope is cause for concern. The methods described in RFC 2544, where overload is a possible outcome, would no doubt be harmful to user traffic performance on a production network. This memo clarifies the scope of RFC 2544 and other benchmarking work for the IETF community.
